airplanes.name: Boeing 747
airplanes.description: The Boeing 747, also known as the 'Jumbo Jet,' is a large, long-range wide-body airliner. It revolutionized long-haul flight with its size and range.

airplanes.name: Airbus A380
airplanes.description: The Airbus A380 is a double-deck, wide-body airliner and the world's largest passenger aircraft, capable of carrying up to 850 passengers.

airplanes.name: Cessna 172
airplanes.description: The Cessna 172 Skyhawk is the best-selling, most-flown aircraft in history, widely used for flight training and personal use.

airplanes.name: Lockheed Martin F-22 Raptor
airplanes.description: The F-22 Raptor is a fifth-generation, stealth tactical fighter aircraft with advanced avionics, stealth capabilities, and high maneuverability.

airplanes.name: Concorde
airplanes.description: The Concorde was a British-French turbojet-powered supersonic passenger airliner, famous for its speed, cruising at twice the speed of sound.

airplanes.name: Piper PA-28 Cherokee
airplanes.description: The Piper PA-28 Cherokee is a family of light aircraft designed for flight training, air taxi, and personal use, known for its ease of handling.

airplanes.name: Sukhoi Su-57
airplanes.description: The Sukhoi Su-57 is a Russian stealth, single-seat, twin-engine multirole fifth-generation jet fighter, designed for air superiority and attack missions.

airplanes.name: Embraer E190
airplanes.description: The Embraer E190 is a narrow-body, twin-engine jet airliner designed for short to medium-haul flights, popular among regional airlines.

airplanes.name: Beechcraft King Air
airplanes.description: The Beechcraft King Air is a family of twin-turboprop aircraft that has been in continuous production since 1964, used for corporate and special mission operations.
